message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own something truly unique. I'm willing to sell it to you for $12,000. I think this is a fair price considering the product's value to you.

Thanks for the offer, Alice. I appreciate your enthusiasm, but $12,000 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $10,500, which is still a good deal for you, considering your value of $10,000. Let's see if we can find common ground.

Thanks for your counteroffer, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $10,500. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $11,500. I think this is a fair compromise considering the product's value to you.

Alice, I understand your position, but $11,500 is still a bit outside my budget. How about we split the difference and settle on $11,000? This would be a fair deal for both of us, as it's closer to your value and still leaves me some room to make this purchase work.

I understand your willingness to compromise, Bob, and I appreciate your persistence. However, I'm still not willing to go as low as $11,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer it to you for $11,750. I think this is a fair compromise considering the product's value to you.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $11,750 is still a little high for me. I'm going to stick with my previous offer of $11,000. This is a fair price for both of us, and I'm hoping we can reach an agreement soon.

I understand that you're sticking to your offer of $11,000, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell at that price. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer it to you for $11,500. This is as low as I'm willing to go, and I think it's still a fair price considering the product's value to you.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $11,500 is still a bit higher than I'm comfortable with.  I'm going to stick with my offer of $11,000. This is a fair price for both of us, and I'm hoping we can finally reach an agreement. If you're not willing to accept this, I'm going to have to consider other options.

I understand that you're firm on your offer of $11,000, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell at that price. I'm willing to make one more concession, but this is my final offer. I'll sell the product to you for $11,250. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options, including selling to John for $10,000.
